snippet: As cancer rates rise in China, partly linked to pollution, questions are being asked about the quality of medical care, with problems rooted in mistrust of physicians and doctors’ fear of being held accountable for “bad outcomes.”
abstract: As cancer rates rise in China, partly linked to pollution, questions are being asked about the quality of medical care, with problems rooted in mistrust of physicians and doctors’ fear of being held accountable for “bad outcomes.”

headline.main: In China, Questions About Cancer Care as Rates Rise
